description: Small dark image file (approximately 50x30 pixels) resembling a game controller silhouette found in iPhone hidden photos folder
concern: Unknown origin - user did not create or save this file. Found in 'hidden' picture files. Possible indicators: (1) Bluetooth controller pairing cache, (2) Gaming app asset, (3) Monitoring software indicator, (4) Cached web asset
actionTaken: Documented via GENESIS, screenshot preserved, seeking forensic analysis

file.sha256: PENDING - Extract file from device to calculate

metadata.description: Dark/black image with controller-like silhouette shape

possibleSources.explanation: When pairing Bluetooth game controllers (PS5, Xbox, etc.), iOS caches device icons
Apps like Xbox, PlayStation Remote, Steam Link store controller icons locally
Safari/Chrome may cache images from gaming websites
Some monitoring apps use innocuous icons to hide their presence. The hidden folder location is concerning.

investigationSteps: 1. Check device Bluetooth history for paired game controllers
2. Review installed apps for gaming-related software
3. Check Settings > Privacy > App Privacy Report for unusual activity
4. Check Settings > General > VPN & Device Management for profiles
5. Extract file from device with full metadata (creation date, app source)
6. Run image through reverse image search

chainOfCustody.notes: User discovered image in iPhone hidden photos folder
Initial documentation created, image shared with Claude for analysis

legalRelevance.relevance: Potential evidence of device monitoring/surveillance. May be relevant to family law proceedings if unauthorized access to device occurred.
